text: Jim Morris (1895-1988) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s. ==Playing career== Morris was a pioneer player at St George, who started in their very first season in Reserve Grade in 1921. He played First Grade the following year and continued playing grade with them until 1928 and spent many years in behind the scenes roles at the club after he retired. Morris was almost the last foundation year player still alive in 1988 besides Reg Fusedale and Ernie Lapham.Whiticker/Hudson "The Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players" 1995 () ==Death== Morris died on 9 April 1988, age 93.SYDNEY MORNING HERALD: Death Notice 11/4/1988 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league players from Sydney Category:Rugby league second-rows Category:Rugby league props Category:1895 births Category:1988 deaths
title: Jim Morris (rugby league)
